messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Dusky Dungeon Delve DATE: 09/09/55 The courtroom was filled with a silent anticipation as the trial progressed. The prosecution brought the officers central to the investigation to the stand. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and your role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Carter, the leading investigator in this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Carter. Can you describe the events leading to the discovery of the hidden dungeon? WITNESS: Indeed. On the night of April 4th, Officer C. D. Davis spotted an unauthorized entry into the old castle which led to the discovery of the hidden dungeon. We initiated an investigation right away. PROSECUTOR: Who conducted the forensic analysis? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Evans and Technician G. H. Fisher were assigned to the forensic examination. PROSECUTOR: Who managed the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Grant and K. L. Harris were in charge of interrogating the suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense then started a cross-examination of Lieutenant Carter concerning the investigative techniques employed. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officers M. N. Irving, O. P. Jenkins, and Q. R. Kennedy were also called to the stand.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Carter 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Carter is the leading investigator in the Dusky Dungeon Delve case, explaining the events leading to the discovery of the hidden dungeon during the trial. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis observed an unauthorized entry into the old castle on the night of April 4th, which led to the unveiling of the hidden dungeon and the subsequent investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans, alongside Technician G. H. Fisher, was responsible for conducting the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Fisher 
Officer Context: Technician Fisher worked with Sergeant E. F. Evans on the forensic analysis concerning the discovered dungeon. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Grant 
Officer Context: Detective Grant, along with Detective K. L. Harris, conducted interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Harris 
Officer Context: Detective Harris, alongside Detective I. J. Grant, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the discovered dungeon. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officers M. N. Irving, O. P. Jenkins, and Q. R. Kennedy 
Officer Context: These Patrol Officers were called to testify during the trial, although their specific roles in the investigation were not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officers
